text: I'm attempting to mirror a fancy-indexed directory, and am sending head requests prior to sending get requests, and noticed that content-length is not defined for files with content-type: text/x-perl , but is defined for the rest of the files.  I'm not sure why.
creator: kernel@pkts.ca
covener@gmail.com
text: Is something other then the default handler rigged to serve those files? what are the response headers on a GET of one?

Apparently, I have egg on my face.  The perl files were not being downloaded, they were being executed, which is why the content-length is not known at the time the headers are sent.  Sorry for wasting your time.
creator: kernel@pkts.ca
